High School Math | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

Okay, here is a list of high school math topics, aiming for a concise overview of key ideas and concepts:

Algebra:

  1. Variables and Expressions
  2. Linear Equations (one variable)
  3. Solving Linear Inequalities
  4. Graphing Linear Equations (slope-intercept form)
  5. Systems of Linear Equations (solving methods)
  6. Exponents and Radicals (properties)
  7. Polynomials (addition, subtraction, multiplication)
  8. Factoring Polynomials (various techniques)
  9. Quadratic Equations (standard form)
  10. Solving Quadratic Equations (factoring, quadratic formula)
  11. Graphing Quadratic Functions (parabolas)
  12. Rational Expressions (simplifying, operations)
  13. Solving Rational Equations
  14. Functions (definition, notation, domain, range)
  15. Types of Functions (linear, quadratic, exponential)
  16. Inverse Functions
  17. Logarithmic Functions (definition, properties)
  18. Solving Exponential and Logarithmic Equations
  19. Sequences and Series (arithmetic, geometric)
  20. Absolute Value Equations and Inequalities

Geometry:

  1. Points, Lines, and Planes
  2. Angles (types, relationships)
  3. Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
  4. Triangles (types, properties, angle sum)
  5. Congruent Triangles (postulates, theorems)
  6. Similar Triangles (properties, ratios)
  7. Pythagorean Theorem
  8. Special Right Triangles (30-60-90, 45-45-90)
  9. Quadrilaterals (types, properties)
  10. Polygons (properties, angle sums)
  11. Circles (parts, properties, circumference, area)
  12. Area of Triangles and Quadrilaterals
  13. Volume of Solids (prisms, cylinders, pyramids, cones, spheres)
  14. Coordinate Geometry (distance, midpoint, slope)
  15. Transformations (translation, reflection, rotation, dilation)
  16. Trigonometry (right triangle ratios: sine, cosine, tangent)
  17. Angles of Elevation and Depression
  18. Unit Circle
  19. Trigonometric Functions (graphs, properties)
  20. Law of Sines and Law of Cosines

Probability and Statistics:

  1. Basic Probability (sample space, events)
  2. Independent and Dependent Events
  3. Conditional Probability
  4. Permutations and Combinations
  5. Measures of Central Tendency (mean, median, mode)
  6. Measures of Dispersion (range, standard deviation)
  7. Data Representation (histograms, box plots, scatter plots)
  8. Correlation and Regression (linear)
  9. Sampling Methods
  10. Basic Statistical Inference

Precalculus Topics (often bridging to higher math):

  1. Polynomial Functions (higher degree)
  2. Rational Functions (graphs, asymptotes)
  3. Trigonometric Identities
  4. Solving Trigonometric Equations
  5. Inverse Trigonometric Functions
  6. Vectors (basic operations)
  7. Matrices (basic operations)
  8. Conic Sections (circles, ellipses, parabolas, hyperbolas)
  9. Limits (informal introduction)
  10. Introduction to Derivatives (informal)

Mathematical Reasoning and Problem Solving:

  1. Inductive and Deductive Reasoning
  2. Logic and Proof (basic concepts)
  3. Problem-Solving Strategies
  4. Mathematical Modeling
  5. Unit Analysis
  6. Estimation and Approximation
  7. Mathematical Communication
  8. Connecting Different Mathematical Concepts
  9. Recognizing Patterns
  10. Developing Mathematical Intuition

Number Systems and Operations:

  1. Real Number System
  2. Properties of Operations (commutative, associative, distributive)
  3. Order of Operations
  4. Scientific Notation
  5. Ratios, Proportions, and Percentages

Functions in Detail:

  1. Composition of Functions
  2. Transformations of Functions (shifts, stretches, reflections)
  3. Piecewise Functions
  4. Even and Odd Functions
  5. Increasing and Decreasing Functions

Advanced Algebra Concepts:

  1. Binomial Theorem
  2. Rational Root Theorem
  3. Fundamental Theorem of Algebra
  4. Partial Fraction Decomposition
  5. Systems of Non-linear Equations

Advanced Geometry Concepts:

  1. Geometric Proofs (more complex)
  2. Solid Geometry (cross-sections, surface area)
  3. Analytic Geometry (equations of lines and planes in 3D)

Advanced Probability and Statistics Concepts:

  1. Probability Distributions (binomial, normal)
  2. Hypothesis Testing (basic concepts)

Discrete Mathematics (sometimes included):

  1. Set Theory (basic concepts)
  2. Logic Gates and Boolean Algebra
  3. Graph Theory (basic concepts)
  4. Counting Principles (advanced)

Mathematical Tools and Technology:

  1. Calculator Usage
  2. Graphing Software
  3. Spreadsheet Software

General Mathematical Habits:

  1. Precision and Accuracy
  2. Perseverance in Problem Solving
  3. Checking and Interpreting Results
